item.source:markdown: Electric Car Cost Per Mile For 277 eCars. https://t.co/oeegTe4nZR

item.description:
Suppose I drive an electric car and I want to drive 100 miles. How much will the electricity cost, approximately?

Same trip for gas-powered cars, how much money would it cost in gallons of gas?

I imagine someone must be keeping track of this in various parts of the country...
item.source:markdown:
Suppose I drive an electric car and I want to drive 100 miles. How much will the electricity cost, approximately?
Same trip for gas-powered cars, how much money would it cost in gallons of gas?
I imagine someone must be keeping track of this in various parts of the country...

item.description: In other words they were overthrowing the government from the inside, not just in Congress. https://t.co/CcGUtlhiLb
item.source:markdown: In other words they were overthrowing the government from the inside, not just in Congress. https://t.co/CcGUtlhiLb

item.description:
@om So many huge silos are only necessary because users don't have an easy place to store their own stuff in the cloud where apps can use the data.

The web is almost a full computer, but it still doesn't have an external disk. I can buy one for my desk, but not in the cloud.
item.source:markdown:
@om So many huge silos are only necessary because users don't have an easy place to store their own stuff in the cloud where apps can use the data.
The web is almost a full computer, but it still doesn't have an external disk. I can buy one for my desk, but not in the cloud.

item.description:
@om Last time I checked Amazon Drive wasn't in any way connected to S3 which is an amazing omission.

Imagine a user-accessible storage system that apps could access. The power is enormous.

No one has done this yet. It has to be done by a company of Amazon's size.

Happy birthday to my very good friend for life, @dsearls.

Keep on truckin! ‚ù§Ô∏è https://t.co/HOk8iU09A9
item.source:markdown:
Happy birthday to my very good friend for life, @dsearls.

item.description:
Facebook locked me out of my account due to security and horrible untested buggy software. üò¨

My phone was turned off. This causes their 2FA to behave badly.

Now the HBO max app on my iPad says I‚Äôm offline. I was, two days ago, but my connection is fine now. Tried rebooting my iPad, no luck.

Deleted app, reinstalled, now it can‚Äôt access cable creds. iOS is a bunch of hairballs in one huge hairball.
item.source:markdown:
Facebook locked me out of my account due to security and horrible untested buggy software. üò¨
My phone was turned off. This causes their 2FA to behave badly.
Now the HBO max app on my iPad says I‚Äôm offline. I was, two days ago, but my connection is fine now. Tried rebooting my iPad, no luck.
Deleted app, reinstalled, now it can‚Äôt access cable creds. iOS is a bunch of hairballs in one huge hairball.

item.description:
@Gartenberg This is what was sure to happen when Apple decided to start fresh with a new OS for iPhones. They would've done better to make one OS and work on factoring out the complexity, removing features that no one uses, instead of creating a new pile of garbage.

@Gartenberg I've made this mistake quite a few times myself btw.

Starting with a clean slate is always nice. Until it gets loaded down like the old system you think you're replacing.
Democrats Close To Changing Laws On Popular Vote. And these assholes are freaking out. https://t.co/GTrIQPtebd
item.source:markdown: Democrats Close To Changing Laws On Popular Vote. And these assholes are freaking out. https://t.co/GTrIQPtebd

item.description:
I ordered a Pixel 6 Pro.

I've been enjoying my iPhone 13 Pro, but I've been wanting to try the pro version of the Pixel.

I've had two phones -- the other a Pixel 4a. Looking forward to trying the same thing without limits.

I got the one with 512GB.
item.source:markdown:
I ordered a Pixel 6 Pro.
I've been enjoying my iPhone 13 Pro, but I've been wanting to try the pro version of the Pixel.
I've had two phones -- the other a Pixel 4a. Looking forward to trying the same thing without limits.
I got the one with 512GB.

item.description: @thesupermikey right. there's some sense that if you call yourself a validator, you are the authority. but it's just a piece of software, and it can have bugs, go out of date, or just plain break.
item.source:markdown: @thesupermikey right. there's some sense that if you call yourself a validator, you are the authority. but it's just a piece of software, and it can have bugs, go out of date, or just plain break.

item.description:
@gruber but you're absolutely right, it's so much better to advise than scold. the programmer priesthood always seems to want to scold the poor newbie.

you and i share these values. it's basic business. i want you to use my product, so i'm going to make you feel smart for choosing it.
item.source:markdown:
@gruber but you're absolutely right, it's so much better to advise than scold. the programmer priesthood always seems to want to scold the poor newbie.
you and i share these values. it's basic business. i want you to use my product, so i'm going to make you feel smart for choosing it.
